newsitem.title: USA: Houston Ship Channel eases some traffic limits.
newsitem.headline: Houston Ship Channel eases some traffic limits.

text.p: The U.S. Coast Guard eased some traffic restrictions along a stretch of the Houston Ship Channel Tuesday where a barge lost a load of six large tanks last week.

Deep-draft ships are asked not to pass or overtake other ships in an 1,800-yard area near milepost 54, Coast Guard officials there said. One-way traffic restrictions have been lifted, though only at the discretion of the channel pilots.

The two larger tanks remain in the channel, which connects the Port of Houston and refinery row to the Gulf of Mexico. Those tanks will be partially emptied before they can be moved, the officials said.
No estimates on when the final tanks would be removed was available.
-- Matt Daily, New York Energy Desk +1 212 859 1620
